intro: Uvaria huana, commonly known as the white uvaria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Uvaria huana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in botanical gardens and ecological studies.
